page.title: 17Skidby Windmill.
page.content: Skidby Windmill is what is known as a Tower Mill. It has been restored so that it is in perfect working order. We are not quite sure the exact date when it was built but the grinding stones are French burr stones dated 1823. There has been a mill on the site for several hundred years. The present mill is unusual for several reasons. Firstly, we know from old pictures that the mill and its buildings have not changed for over a hundred years. Secondly, the fantail which keeps the sails facing the wind is not the same design as other East Riding mills. In a Tower Mill only the top of the mill turns to face the wind. Thirdly, the top of the mill was raised to take the present sails which are bigger than the original sails. We think the wood used to raise the mill came from the old Cottingham Low Mill.
